document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the spider genus Sparianthis Simon, 1880 (Araneae, Sparassidae Sparianthinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the spider genus Sparianthis Simon, 1880 (Araneae, Sparassidae Sparianthinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tentabunda chickeringi
Gertsch, 1941: 12
, fig. 33 ( Holotype ♀ from Panama , Canal Zone , Barro Colorado Island [ 9.1500 , - 79.8333 ], AMNH, examined).

Pseudosparianthis chickeringi
.
Roewer 1955: 683
, World Spider Catalog 2020 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Males of
S. chickeringi
resemble those of
S. caracarai
sp. nov.
and
S. ravida
by the palp with mRTA represented by small, short, blunt projection, arising from tibia, close to vRTA ( Figs 34 , 50 , 139 ). They are distinguished from the latter species by the TBE with apical projection gutter-shaped and TBC reduced to narrow keel, not covering base of conductor (TBE with distal projection short and laminar and TBC wider, covering base of conductor in the other species) ( Fig. 49 ). Females are distinguished from all other species of the genus by anterior furrow medially indented and lateral lobes bearing secondary furrows that extend anteriorly reaching anterior furrow ( Figs 46 , 51 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 39–42.
Sparianthis chickeringi (Gertsch)
, habitus. 39–40 male (MCZ 69094) (39 dorsal, 40 ventral); 41–42 female (MCZ 69094) (41 dorsal, 42 ventral). Scale lines: 2 mm.

FIGURES 43–47.
Sparianthis chickeringi (Gertsch)
. 43–45 male (MCZ 69094), left palp (43 prolateral, 44 ventral, 45 retrolateral); 46–47 female (MCZ 69094) (46 epigyne, 47 vulva). Scale lines: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Female ( MCZ 69094 ):
coloration pattern as in male, much lighter. Opisthosoma ventrally with more lateral marks on posterior half and less conspicuous muscle sigilla ( Figs 41–42 ). Total length 11.6. Prosoma: 5.1 long, 4.1 wide. Opisthosoma: 6.4 long, 3.5 wide. Eyes: diameters: 0.30, 0.25, 0.17, 0.24; interdistances: 0.34, 0.13, 0.55, 0.34, 0.21, 0.14. Legs (1243): I: 14.9 (4.4, 2.4, 3.9, 3.4, 0.8); II: 14.6 (4.4, 2.4, 3.6, 3.4, 0.8); III: 11.5 (3.6, 1.9, 2.6, 2.6, 0.8); IV: 13.7 (4.2, 1.8, 3.1, 3.7, 0.9). Spination follows the generic pattern except tibia III: r1-0- 1; tibia IV d0-0-1; metatarsus IV r1-1-0. Metatarsus III with single, ventral distal spine; metatarsus IV with ventral distal preening comb. Epigyne: epigynal field rectangular, longer than wide; median septum longer than wide, narrowed anteriorly, with posterior margin rounded ( Figs 46 , 51 ). Vulva: internal ducts slender, approximately one fourth spermathecae width from copulatory openings to first turn and half spermathecae width from first turn to spermathecae; first turn anteriad; glandular projection large, rounded, arising from ducts at first turn; spermathecae oval, consisting of coiled ducts ( Figs 47 , 52–53 ).
Variation. Male (n = 10): total length: 10.5–12.5; prosoma length 5.0–5.5; femur I length 4.5–5.2. Females (n = 10): Total length 10.8–16.0; prosoma length 4.7–6.0; femur I length 3.7–4.6.
Distribution. Known from central Panama , Canal Zone and Colón ( Fig. 144 ).
